analysis.Summary: This file defines the route configuration for the "spots" section of a Vue.js application using the Martyrs framework. It sets up nested routes for listing spots by country, state, and city, as well as routes for creating, viewing, and editing individual spots.
analysis.Purpose: To centralize and export the Vue Router definition for all "spots"-related paths, including layout components, metadata (titles, themes, breadcrumbs), dynamic imports of page components, and authentication guards.

Components.name: layoutEmpty
Components.role: Top-level layout wrapper for the spots module

Components.name: layoutSpots
Components.role: Secondary layout for spots listing pages

Functions.name: () => import(/* webpackChunkName: 'Deliveries' */ '../components/pages/Map.vue')
Functions.purpose: Lazy-load the Map page component for state and city views

Functions.name: validationAuth.requiresAuth
Functions.purpose: Navigation guard to ensure the user is authenticated before entering certain routes

analysis.Usage: Imported into the main router index (e.g., in src/router/index.js or a modules aggregator) and added to the routes array to enable navigation to all spots-related pages.
Notes: Uses optional route parameters (country, state, city) to build a nested drill-down UI in a single route tree.
Metadata fields define multilingual titles and theming for headers/footers.
Breadcrumbs are hidden at the top level to streamline the navigation experience.
Webpack chunk names are provided for code-splitting and grouping spot-related resources.
Authentication guard is applied only to creation, detail, and edit routes, not to the public listing.
